summary: This bill, H.R. 2453, aims to indefinitely continue Executive Order 14224, which designated English as the official language of the United States. Introduced on March 27, 2025, by Representatives Miller-Meeks and Harshbarger, the bill was referred to the Committees on Education and Workforce, and Oversight and Government Reform. The bill also specifies that any actions or regulations issued by federal agencies pursuant to Executive Order 14224 will remain in effect. The bill is not subject to copyright and is in the public domain.
